Package javelin

Class Javelin

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.Javelin
  • public class Javelin
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for broad-level rules and game-behavior. Add the VM argument -Ddebug=true to the java command line for easier debugging and logging.
    See Also:
    DEBUG

      • getDayPeriod

        public static java.lang.String getDayPeriod()
        TODO move to a new class with proper enum?
        Returns:
        PERIODEVENING, PERIODMORNING, PERIODNIGHT or "Noon".

      • getHour

        public static long getHour()
        If Squad.active is null for any reason, will return zero.
        Returns:
        Hour of the day, from 0 to 23.

      • act

        public static Squad act()
        This is also the only function that should write to Squad.active so it should be called with extreme caution to avoid changing it in the middle of an action.
        Returns:
        Next squad to act.

      • nexttoact

        public static Squad nexttoact()
        Returns:
        Next squad to act.
        See Also:
        Squad.hourselapsed

      • welcome

        public static java.lang.String welcome()
        Pure fluff/flavor.
        Returns:
        Welcomes the playet to the game based on the current time of the day.

      • lose

        public static void lose()
        Once the player has no more Squads and Combatants under his control call this to stop the current game, invalidate the save file, record the highscore and exit the application.

      • translatetochance

        public static java.lang.String translatetochance​(int rolltohit)
        Parameters:
        rolltohit - The number that needs to be rolled on a d20 for this action to succeed.
        Returns:
        A textual representation of how easy or hard this action is to achieve.

      • choose

        public static int choose​(java.lang.String prompt,
                         java.util.List<?> names,
                         boolean fullscreen,
                         boolean forceselection)
        Utility function for user-input selection. TODO due to the UI being poor, if this method runs out of alphanumeric characters to use, it will display more choices but not allow the player to actually select them.
        Parameters:
        prompt - Text to show the user.
        names - Will show each's Object.toString() as an option.
        fullscreen - true to open in a new screen. Otherwise uses the message panel.
        forceselection - If false will allow the user to abort the operation.
        Returns:
        The index of the selected element or -1 if aborted. Won't return an invalid index other than -1.

      • message

        public static java.awt.event.KeyEvent message​(java.lang.String text,
                                              boolean requireenter)
        Main output function for WorldScreen. Waits for user input for confirmation.
        Parameters:
        text - Prints this message in the status panel.
        requireenter - If true will wait for the player to press ENTER, otherwise any key will do.
        Returns:
        the key pressed by the user as confirmation for seeing the message.

      • prompt

        public static java.lang.Character prompt​(java.lang.String prompt,
                                         boolean center)
        Prompts a message in the WorldScreen.
        Parameters:
        prompt - Text to show.
        Returns:
        Any InfoScreen.feedback().

        Returns:

      • round

        public static int round​(int gold)
        Example: 194,151 will be "rounded" to 190,000. A 10% loss of precision is expected at most but it tends to normalize (and lessen with the game's exponential increase as challenge levels rise). The loss of precision is easily worth the much higher readability.
        Parameters:
        gold - A value in gold or other unit that needn't be precise.
        Returns:
        The input value, but rounded off as to be more legible.

      • getmonster

        public static Monster getmonster​(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - Monster type. Example: orc, kobold, young white dragon... Case insensitive.
        Returns:
        A clone.
        See Also:
        Monster.clone()
